entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Magierhand
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 8 Stunden (10 Minuten)

Ein Verschmelzungsschild kann mit einer gehaltenen Einhand- oder leichten Waffe verschmelzen. Der Tr√§ger w√§hlt jede Runde, ob er mit der Waffe angreifen oder sich mit dem Schild verteidigen will. Das Verschmelzen oder Befreien des Schildes ist eine Bonusaktion. Der Schild muss getragen werden, um ihn mit einer Waffe zu verschmelzen; die Umkehrung der Verschmelzung bedeutet, dass der Schild wieder getragen wird. W√§hrend der Schild verschmolzen ist, kann der Tr√§ger nur mit dieser Hand mit der Waffe angreifen oder sich mit dem Schild verteidigen (und nicht z.B. zaubern oder Gegenst√§nde manipulieren). Angriffsw√ºrfe mit der Waffe haben einen Nachteil, wenn sie mit dem Schild verschmolzen sind. Wenn die Tr√§gerin mit der verschmolzenen Waffe angreift, verliert sie den Bonus des Schildes auf den AC bis zum Beginn ihrer n√§chsten Runde. Ein verschmolzener Schild kann nicht zum Schildschlag verwendet werden.

spell.name: Armor, Hosteling

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Leomunds Geheimtruhe, Tierbeschw√∂rung, Bestienbindung

Eine R√ºstung oder ein Schild mit dieser besonderen F√§higkeit verbirgt lebende Tiere in ihrer Ikonographie, um sie zu sch√ºtzen. Der Tr√§ger kann ein Befehlswort sprechen, um ein Tier, zu dem er eine Bindung hat, wie z.B. einen tierischen Begleiter, einen Vertrauten, ein trainiertes Haustier oder ein Reittier, magisch zu speichern. Das gespeicherte Tier erscheint als ein Symbol auf der R√ºstung oder dem Schild, das entweder das Aussehen des Tieres nachahmt oder eher symbolisch und abstrakt ist.

W√§hrend das Tier gelagert wird, schl√§ft es und bringt dem Tr√§ger keine Vorteile. Die Gr√∂√üe und Anzahl der Tiere, die gespeichert werden k√∂nnen, h√§ngt von der Art der R√ºstung oder des Schildes ab. Eine leichte R√ºstung (eine Kreatur, eine Gr√∂√üe kleiner als der Tr√§ger), eine mittlere R√ºstung oder ein leichter Schild (eine Kreatur, gleiche Gr√∂√üe wie der Tr√§ger (Mittel)); eine schwere R√ºstung, ein Turmschild (eine Gr√∂√üenklasse gr√∂√üer als der Tr√§ger (Gro√ü)). Als Bonus- oder Angriffsaktion befreit ein zweites Kommandowort das gespeicherte Tier aus der Geisel-R√ºstung oder dem Schild. Ein freigelassenes Tier erwacht sofort, erscheint in einem Raum neben dem Tr√§ger und kann in der Runde, in der es erscheint, Aktionen ausf√ºhren. Magische R√ºstungen gew√§hren zus√§tzlichen Raum, einen zus√§tzlichen Raum in der Gr√∂√üe, die die R√ºstung und ihr Tr√§ger zulassen, oder 2 R√§ume in der Gr√∂√üe einer Kategorie kleiner.

Da das gelagerte Tier schl√§ft und sich nicht in einer Art Scheintod befindet (oder gar einen Winterschlaf h√§lt), altert es und wird hungrig, solange es gelagert wird, in normalem Tempo. Eine Geisel-R√ºstung oder ein Geisel-Schild gibt ein eingelagertes Tier automatisch 24 Stunden nach der Einlagerung frei.

Diese besondere F√§higkeit der R√ºstung funktioniert immer noch bei gebundenen magischen Bestien, die einst Tiere waren (Beasts), aber nicht bei Himmlischen, Unholden, Oozes oder anderen Vorlagen f√ºr Begleitkreaturen.

entries: {@b SCHEMA:}
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 Minuten

Ein Charakter kann das Gift in dieser Phiole verwenden, um eine Hieb- oder Stichwaffe oder ein einzelnes St√ºck Munition zu beschichten. Das Auftragen des Giftes erfordert eine Aktion. Eine Kreatur, die von der vergifteten Waffe oder Munition getroffen wird, muss einen Rettungswurf auf Konstitution bestehen oder wird 1 Minute lang von dem Gift beeinflusst. Eine betroffene Kreatur muss zu Beginn jeder Runde einen Rettungswurf der Intelligenz bestehen oder 6d6 nekrotischen Schaden erleiden und 1 Stufe Ersch√∂pfung erleiden. Ein erfolgreicher Rettungswurf reduziert den Schaden um die H√§lfte und beendet den Effekt, dass man jede Runde retten muss. Eine Kreatur, die stirbt, w√§hrend sie von diesem Gift betroffen ist, zerf√§llt zu schwach leuchtendem Staub.
Wenn dieselbe Kreatur von mehreren Quellen von Eldritch Poison betroffen ist, sind die Effekte {@i do not stack}, aber die Kreatur rettet mit Nachteil.

Als Aktion kann ein Charakter eine Phiole mit Sturm in Flaschen bis zu 120 Fu√ü weit werfen. Die Phiole setzt einen Sturm frei, der sich von der Stelle, an der die Phiole f√§llt, 30 Fu√ü weit und 150 Fu√ü hoch in die Luft ausbreitet. Dieser Sturm h√§lt 1 Minute lang an. Sintflutartige Regenf√§lle sorgen daf√ºr, dass das Gebiet stark verdunkelt wird.

Jede Kreatur, die ihren Zug im Sturm beginnt oder ihn betritt, muss einen Rettungswurf in Geschicklichkeit ablegen oder wird vom Blitz getroffen. Bei einem misslungenen Rettungswurf erleidet sie 4d8 Blitzschaden, bei einem erfolgreichen Rettungswurf halb so viel. Kreaturen, die eine Metallr√ºstung tragen oder aus Metall bestehen, haben bei diesem Rettungswurf einen Nachteil.
Der Sturm h√§lt bis zu 10 Minuten an.

{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Minute

As an action, a character can throw the vial of alchemist's frost up to 20 feet. Make a ranged attack against the target, treating the vial as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 cold damage, and has its speed reduced by 10 feet for 1 round. If the creature's speed is reduced to 0 it is frozen (Grappled) in place, and must spend an action to break free, Strength (Athletics) check against Infusion DC.

At 10th Level - base 2d10 cold damage and speed is reduced by 15 for 1 round.

{@b CRAFTING TIME:}
This weapon deals an extra 1d6 radiant damage.

In addition, this weapon has 3 charges. When the wielder hits with an attack, the wielder can expend a charge to allow one ally within 30 feet of the wielder to regain hit points equal to the extra radiant damage dealt. Doing so expends 1 charge. As an action, the wielder of this weapon can touch it to another creature and expend 3 charges to remove the effect of a single disease or poison from that creature.
For every two extra point you spend, the weapon gains an additional charge. If you spend eight infusion points, the weapon deals an extra 1d6 radiant damage.

spell.name: Arcane Sanctum Sanctorum
entries: {@b SCHEMA:}  Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum, Forbiddance, Hallow, Mordenkainen's Magnificent Mansion, or  Nondetection.
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 1 week (10 minutes)
You make an area you prepare over a week for your future infusions (10 minutes each) magically secure. The area is a cube that can be from 1 foot to as large as 100 feet on each side.
When you infuse it, you decide what sort of security the infusion provides, choosing any or all of the following properties:

items: Sound can't pass through the barrier at the edge of the warded area.
The barrier of the warded area appears dark and foggy, preventing vision (including darkvision) through it.
Sensors created by divination spells can't appear inside the protected area or pass through the barrier at its perimeter.
Creatures in the area can't be targeted by divination spells.
Nothing can teleport into or out of the warded area.
Planar travel is blocked within the warded area.

entries: For 1 Extra Infusion points per effect: Some of the following effects can be applied to specific creatures in the area; you can designate whether the effect applies to all creatures, creatures that follow a specific deity or leader, or creatures of a specific sort, such as ogres or trolls. When a creature that would be affected enters the infused area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it can make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature ignores the extra effect until it leaves the area.

entries.name: Bane:

items: Darkness -Darkness fills the area. Normal light, as well as magical light created by spells of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell, can't illuminate the area.
Energy Vulnerability - Affected creatures in the area have vulnerability to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
Extradimensional Interference - Affected creatures can't move or travel using teleportation or by extradimensional or interplanar means.
Fear  - Affected creatures are frightened while in the area.

entries: When the chosen creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature takes 2d10 radiant or necrotic damage (your choice when you Infusion is made) : May increase 1d10 for every  2 addition Infusion Points spent.

items: Daylight - Bright light fills the area. Magical darkness created by spells of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell can't extinguish the light.
Courage - Affected creatures can't be frightened while in the area.
Energy Protection - Affected creatures in the area have resistance to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
Everlasting Rest - Dead bodies interred in the area can't be turned into undead.
Tongues - Affected creatures can communicate with any other creature in the area, even if they don't share a common language.

entries: Crafting this infusion on the same spot every day for a year makes this effect permanent. Creatures that save versus a negative (Bane Effect) are immune to that effect for the day, re-entering the next day, they are again subject to the effects and must save, again.

entries: {@b SCHEMA:} Blade Ward
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 10 Minuten [1 Aktion]
{@b Duration}: 1 Day

This armor has 1 charge. When the wearer of this armor would take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, the wearer can expend a charge as reaction to gain +2AC, and resistance to that attack. Doing so expends 1 infusion point.

For every extra infusion point you spend, this armor gains an additional charge. At the end of the infusion the armor loses 1 AC value per charge expended, an armor with the offers no AC bonus is broken.

spell.name: Ammunition, Blight
entries: {@b SCHEMA:} lightning arrow or Magic Stone; chill touch or inflict Wounds
{@b CRAFTING TIME:} 2 Hours [10 minutes]

Necromantic energy washes over a creature struck, draining moisture and vitality from it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes an additional 4d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This effect does nothing to undead or constructs.
If you target a plant creature or a magical plant, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.
If you target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, it doesn't make a saving throw; it simply withers and dies.
For every two extra point you spend, the ammo deal an additional 1d8 necrotic damage.

spell.name: Weapon of Bleeding
entries: {@B SCHEMA:}  Hex, Magic Weapon
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 hour [10 minutes]

This infusion can only be applied to weapons that deal piercing or slashing damage. A living creature hit by this weapon must make a Constitution saving throw or take 1 point necrotic damage at the start of every turn for 1 minute (stacks). The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of every turn, ending the effect on a successful save. Another creature can aid by making a Wisdom (Medicine) successful check, or healing the creature, thus ending the effect.

{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minutes

This special ability can only be placed on melee weapons. A nullifying weapon suppresses a creature's resistance for a short amount of time. Anytime the weapon strikes a creature with a resistance and the creature takes damage as it would normally, and until the start of your your turn the creature loses one resistance or has their immunity reduced to resistance. On a critical hit, the creature instead gains vulnerability to the damage type.

spell.name: Weapon, Ominous
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Magic Weapon, Eyebite, bane
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minutes
{@i This can only be placed on an already magical/enchanted melee weapons.}

An ominous weapon trails a shadowy haze behind every stroke, and moans a menacing dirge in battle. An ominous weapon adds its enhancement bonus on Intimidate checks made by the wielder. In addition, when an ominous weapon gets a critical hit, the target is affected by Bane (Charisma Save negates).  This condition lasts until the wielder strikes another creature. A creature that succeeds its save against a Band critical hit, cannot be the subject of such from the same weapon for 24 hours.

The infused weapon (single melee or up to 20 arrows, bolts or bullets), Is unable to lethal damage, but delivers an additional of the weapon's die of temporary damage.  Upon a critical hit, the target gains  the Poisoned condition (Constitution save each round to remove the condition). If ever the creature is struck for real damage before they complete a short rest the temporary damage is removed.

spell.name: Weapon, Sharding
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Magic Missile,  Phantasmal Killer, and either (Mordenkainen's Sword or Spiritual Weapon)
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Hour [10 minutes]
{@i This may not be combined with other Infusions or spell like abilities that extend weapon damage.}

The wielder of a sharding weapon can take an action to make a ranged spell attack with the weapon in place of an attack action. To do this, the wielder goes through the motion of throwing the weapon without releasing it. The weapon splits off a Illusory duplicate of itself that flies as if thrown by the wielder at the intended target. The duplicate gains a range of 30/60 feet for this purpose. The illusory weapon deals Psychic damage and adds the wielder's spell ability modifier to damage dealt, but otherwise functions the same as the original weapon. The duplicate vanishes after hitting or missing its target, and leaves no marks.

Infused weapons gain the Siege weapon property, dealing double damage to inanimate objects such as structures.

spell.name: Weapon, Spell Stealing

m.text: one time cost of scroll of feeblemind or 100gp; weapon [reusable]

entries: {@B SCHEMA:}
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Day [10 Minutes]
{@i This infusion can only be placed on melee or natural weapons}

A spellstealing weapon allows its wielder to siphon magic from a target and transfer it to themselves. When the wielder rolls a critical threat against a target, they automatically learn which spells or magical effects are active upon the target. The wielder may then make an Arcana check against the spell DC to steal her choice of one of those effects, the spellstealing weapon's enhancement bonus is added to the Abilty check value. If the check succeeds, the target immediately loses the benefits of that effect and the wielder gains the effect for 1 minute (or until the effect expires).
If the creature has no effects; and is spellcaster - they instead lose one of their lowest availible level spell slots.

spell.name: Weapon, Stalking
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Magic Weapon, True Strike, Guidance; Hunter's Mark or Hex
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 day [10 minutes]

The longer the wielder of a stalking weapon studies a  target, the more effective her strike. As your action, a character wielding a stalking weapon can command  it to study a creature within 60 feet. The wielder must  have line of effect and line of sight to that target. When the wielder attacks the studied creature, on a successful hit the stalking weapon deals +1d6 points of bonus damage per consecutive round spent studying a target, up to a number of bonus dice equal to the wielder's proficiency bonus. This bonus damage is precision damage and only applies to the first successful hit against that  creature. If the wielder attacks a creature other than the studied creature, studies a different  creature, or ends her turn more than 60 feet from the studied creature, the weapon loses all bonus damage dice against the target.

entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Poison Spray; Booming Blade
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 hour [10 minutes]

When first infused, this weapon generates its own venom. The first time the wielder of this weapon hits with an attack after it has been envenomed, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 poison damage.  Upon a successful hit, the target makes a CON save or becomes {@condition Poisoned}; at the start of their next round they may choose to use a bonus action to and save to attempt to remove the {@condition poisoned} conition; which will run out after they save; or 1 minute passes.
For every three extra infusion points you spend, the poison damage dealt by this weapon increases by 1d4.

spell.name: Weapon, Tailwind
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Gust of Wind
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minutes
{@i This infusion can be placed only on ranged weapon attacks (Thrown or Projectile).}

Whenever a tailwind weapon is used to make a ranged attack, the weapon or its projectile is pushed along by a powerful tailwind that fills its space. It can still extinguish unprotected flames and accomplish anything a sudden burst of wind could. The tailwind negates range penalties to the weapon's attack; if the attack is successful within its standard range, the creature struck must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you.

spell.name: Weapon, Thundering
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Magic Weapon and (Spiritual Weapon or Mage Hand)
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minutes

A thundering melee weapon creates a cacophonous roar like thunder whenever it strikes a target with a successful critical hit. The thunder damage does not harm the wielder. A thundering weapon deals an extra 1d8 thunder damage on a successful critical hit.

When applied to Ranged weapons (up to 10 arrows, bolts, or bullets), the attack deals an additional 1d6 thunder damage to the target on a successful strike, as well as 1d6 thunder to in the path of the bullet (excluding the wielder).
Creatures dealt thunder damage must make a successful Constitution DC save or be deafened for up to 1 minute (They make an additional Constitution save each round to end Deafened condition).
For every two extra infusion points spent, the weapon's thunder damage increases 1 die.

entries: {@B SCHEMA:} Vampiric Touch,  Magic Weapon
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 hour [10 minutes]

In addition, this weapon has 3 charges. When the wielder hits with an attack, the wielder can expend a charge to gain temporary hit points equal to the extra necrotic damage dealt.
For every 3 extra infusion points you spend, the weapon gains an additional charge.
If you spend nine extra infusion points, the weapon deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage.

{@b Schema}: sind die Zauberstrukturen, die der {@class Artificer|MMMxArtificer} kennen muss, um den Aufguss verwenden zu k√∂nnen.

{@b Crafting Time}: Die Herstellungszeit kann verschiedene Werte haben: die Zeit, die f√ºr die anf√§ngliche Arbeit ben√∂tigt wird, und dann einen zus√§tzlichen Wert f√ºr den Fall, dass sie von einer fr√ºheren Verwendung wieder aufgef√ºllt wird.
F√ºr weitere Informationen - siehe {@book Artificer details|MMMxArtificer} f√ºr weitere Informationen und Beschreibung der neuen Mechanik f√ºr die Klasse.

spell.name: Bond Item
entries: {@B SCHEMA:} blink; dimension door; teleport or Leomund's Secret Chest
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 1 Hour [10 minutes]
You touch a item weighing no more than {@homebrew 50|100} pounds and form a link between you and it. Until the spell ends, you can recall it to your hand as a bonus action.

If another creature is holding or wearing the item when you try to recall it, they make a Charisma saving throw, and if they succeed, the spell fails. They make this save with advantage if they have had possession of the item for more than 1 minute.

spell.name: Arcane Weapon
entries: {@B SCHEMA:}
{@B CRAFTING TIME:} 10 minutes
You touch a weapon and imbue it with magic. For the duration the weapon counts as a magical weapon, any damage dealt by it is Force damage.

classFeature.name: Polyglot
entries: During Character Creation - When choosing your background, if the background includes a skill you already have, rather than chose another skill, you instead learn an additional Language.
You gain an additional language every 4 levels after 1st (ie 5th, 9th; 13th; 17th;)

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to tangle and force the shape of the fabric of reality in discord to and in alignment to your wishes and as such spells are part of your repertoire. Its magic is something that you can use to co-opt and corrupt the efforts of others in situations. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the PHB for the general rules of spellcasting and below for the {@filter dirge spell list|spells|class=dirge|source=reddit_UA}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the Dirdge spell list. You learn additional Dirge cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the {@filter dirge spell list|spells|class=dirge|source=reddit_UA}.

entries.name: Spell Points
entries: The table above tells how many spell points you have to cast your spells. To cast one of these spells. you must expend one point per level of the Spell Slot of the spell you wish to cast. You regain half of all your expended spell slots when you finish a short rest, and all them on a long rest.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Dirge spells. Your magic comes from the ability to warp reality and force patterns, it is in part divine, and in part aberrant ability of your force of will bringing the world into more chaos. Use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a dirge spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast any bard spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an book focus (found in chapter 5) as a spellcasting focus for your dirge spells.

entries.name: Learning Spells of 1st Level and Higher
entries: Each time you gain a dirge level, you can add one dirge spells of your choice to your spellbook. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots, as shown on the {@filter dirge spell list|spells|class=dirge|source=reddit_UA} table. On your adventures, you might find other spells that you can add to your spellbook (see "Your Spellbook").

entries.name: Your Spellbook
entries: The spells that you add to your spellbook as you gain levels reflect the arcane research you conduct on your own, as well as intellectual breakthroughs you have had about the nature of the multiverse. You might find other spells during your adventures. You could discover a spell recorded on a scroll in an evil creature's library, for example, or in a dusty tome in an ancient library.
A spellbook doesn't contain cantrips.

entries.name: Copying a Spell into the Book
entries: When you find a spell of 1st level or higher that is on your spell list, you can add it to your spellbook if it is of a spell level you can prepare and if you can spare the time to decipher and copy it.

Copying a spell into your spellbook involves reproducing the basic form of the spell, then deciphering the unique system of notation used by the spellcaster who wrote it. You must practice the spell until you understand the sounds or gestures required, then transcribe it into your spellbook using your own notation.

For each level of the spell, the process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it. Once you have spent this time and money, you can prepare the spell just like your other spells.

A spell on scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When you copy a spell from a spell scroll, you must succeed on an Intelligence (Arcana) check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

entries.name: Replacing the Book
entries: You can copy a spell from your own spellbook into another book—for example, if you want to make a backup copy of your spellbook. This is just like copying a new spell into your spellbook, but faster and easier, since you understand your own notation and already know how to cast the spell. You need spend only 1 hour and 10 gp for each level of the copied spell.

If you lose your spellbook, you can use the same procedure to transcribe the spells that you have prepared into a new spellbook. Filling out the remainder of your spellbook requires you to find new spells to do so, as normal. For this reason, many casters keep backup spellbooks in a safe place.

entries.name: The Book's Appearance
entries: Your book is a unique compilation of spells, poems, music notation, and stains, with its own decorative flourishes and margin notes. It might be a plain, functional leather volume that you received as a gift from your master, a finely bound gilt-edged tome you found in an ancient library, or even a loose collection of notes scrounged together after you lost your previous spellbook in a mishap.

classFeature.name: Enervate
entries: You discourage others through biting words, rebukes, and statistical probabilities of their failure and eventual death at a loved one's hands.

To do so, you use a reaction to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can hear YOU. That creature rolls your Enervation die, a 1d6 at 1st level, and "subtracts" the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. You can choose to use this feature after the creature makes its roll, but before the DM determines whether the attack roll or ability check succeeds or fails, or before the creature does damage. If the creature can't hear, or doesn't speak your language the enervation fails. Creatures that are immune to Charm, or are Constructs are immune.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Your Enervation die changes when you reach certain levels in this class; at 5th level (d8), at 10th level (d10), and finally at 15th level (2d6).

classFeature.name: Expertise/Master of None
entries: Choose three of your skills proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that the chosen proficiencies. HOWEVER; After a long rest you temporarily lose any proficiency bonus in one skill you have (had) expertise until your next long rest (determined randomly).
You gain half of your proficiency bonus (or Your Intelligence Ability Modifier - whichever is greater) on all Tools, Kits, and Charisma-based checks with which you are non-proficient.
At 10th level, you can choose another two skill proficiencies to gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Familiar
entries: At 2nd level you will acquire a familiar/animal companion.

This isn't a {@italic magical} familiar, if lost/killed it cannot be resummoned. It gains +2 HP with each level the Dirge obtains while with that familar.  If the familiar dies unlike a Ranger animal companions or wizard/warlock familars, you don't resummon it during a ritual long rest. No, you have to go find another one. You must buy/steal or coax it into your service if you need to replace it. Once the type of creature is chosen it is the one type that grants you those benefits alone. If you have a goat and then after its tragic (but expected) death, you cannot switch to a cat. You are stuck with a goat (or whatever).
Your familiar gains HP are also

classFeature.name: Emotionally Abusive
entries: You may add your Intelligence Modifier to any Psychic damage source you deal.

classFeature.name: Meh
entries: Starting at 4th level, you unlock similar powers similar to Warlock's Invocations called {@filter Mehs|optionalfeatures|source=reddit_UA} these are abilities, powers, or enhancements .

You may additionally choose from the following invocations from Warlocks: {@optfeature Bewitching Whispers}, {@optfeature Chains of Carceri}, {@optfeature Dreadful Word}, {@optfeature Eyes of the Run Keeper}, {@optfeature Fiendish Vigor}, {@optfeature Mask of Many Faces}, {@optfeature Mire the Mind}, {@optfeature Misty Visions}, {@optfeature Witch Sight}.

classFeature.name: Tough Love
entries: At 3rd level, you use a bonus action to use your biting tongue to compel a target creature within 60 ft. to redouble their efforts and do better. It is not nice, and its very pointed, but the target receives an enervation die or your Charisma Modifier to enhance an Attack roll To Hit, for Damage, Saves, Ability and Skill checks.

The Target Takes an enervation die of Psychic Damage to their Max HP until the die is used (after which the damage may be healed normally). Once given the recipient has 1 minute to use this die before or after they make a roll, but always before the DM determines whether the attack roll or ability is successful.

classFeature.name: Divine Filler
entries: At 3rd level, You really receive nothing from this.

But that's reality. However, at this seemingly arbitrary point in your development, you must choose a path of philosophy and develop toward such. You don't gain anything, but later on, you'll have to keep to your decision you make today...

items: {@bold Epistemological} - all knowledge is accepted as possibly untrue or unable to be known. Additionally, morality is seen as subjective or false.

{@bold Existential} - life has no intrinsic meaning or value. With respect to the universe, existential nihilism posits that a single human or even the entire human species is insignificant, without purpose and unlikely to change in the totality of existence.

{@bold Mereologic} - is the position that objects with proper parts do not exist (not only objects in space but also objects existing in time do not have any temporal parts), and only basic building blocks without parts exist, and thus the world we see and experience full of objects with parts is a product of human misrepresentation (i.e., if we could see clearly, we would not perceive compositive objects).

classFeature.name: Placebo
entries: At 3rd Level you gain the ability as an full round to use a placebo. Taking Water or wine, or whatever - you roll a performance check (action)

Upon administering the Placebo to a single creature (bonus action), the creature(s) makes a Wisdom save with disadvantage against your performance roll as the DC, if they fail they get better (2d4 temporary hit points), and 1 real hp. The creature and you must be able to understand each other for this to happen.
You may do this any number of times, sadly until a creature successfully saves against your Placebo.
Once a creature saves, That creature cannot benefit from your placebo, ever, and you may not use another placebo until a day has passed.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Disruptive Banter
entries: At 5th level, you gain the ability to use your Enervation to disrupt a single spell or mind-influencing effect. As an action, you can start a {skill performance} that lasts up to a minute. During that time, you and any allied creatures within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed. And nonfriendly creatures are at disadvantage for such.

A creature must share a language and be able to hear you to be affected. The performance ends early if you are incapacitated or silenced or if you voluntarily end it (no action required). Hostile Creatures attempting to maintain concentration must make a save each against your spell DC. If their concentration is broken, they take d6 psychic damage as a backlash.

classFeature.name: Enervate (d8)
entries: Your Enervation die changes to (d8).

classFeature.name: Channel snort "Divinity"
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to channel so called {@bold divine} energy directly once per every long rest from your angst over the nature and paradox of divinity, using that energy to fuel magical effects. You must then finish a long rest to use your Channel Divinity again. Some Channel Divinity effects require saving throws.
When you use such an effect from this class, the DC equals your Dirge spell save DC.

Beginning at 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity twice between rests, and beginning at 18th level, you can use it three times between rests. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain your expended uses.

entries.name: Channel: Divinity
entries: As an reaction, you speak to a creature with that can hear and understand your language within 30 ft. has disadvantage imposed upon its roll.

classFeature.name: Troll's Regeneration
entries: Beginning when you reach 6th level, you regain all of your expended uses of Enervation when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Orator
entries: At 7th level, you gain the ability to use {@spell Tongues} (as the spell - but without spell components costs) once per rest. You regain the use of this when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Enervate (d10)
entries: At 9th level, your Enervation die changes to (d10).

classFeature.name: Expertise/Master of None (2)
entries: At 10th level, you can choose another two skill proficiencies, double the proficiency bonus for these skills, however you now lose proficiency with two skills at random per long rest.

classFeature.name: Philosophical Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gane a subclass feature from your chosen Philosophical Pact.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Philosophical Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gane a subclass feature from your chosen Philosophical Pact.

classFeature.name: Dark Thoughts
entries: Beginning at 10th level, your angst hones your mental fortitude. You have resistance to psychic damage, and whenever a creature deals psychic damage to you, as a reaction that creature takes half that damage. Attempts to gain insight into you are at disadvantage; you turn the mind-affecting magic of your enemies against them and you are immune to being charmed. When another creature attempts to charm you, you can use your reaction to attempt to turn the charm back on that creature, in addition that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be frightened by you for 1 minute.

classFeature.name: Shared Delusion
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can plunge a creature into an illusory realm. As an action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. It must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, it is charmed or frightened by you (your choice made before their save) for 1 minute or until your concentration is broken (as if you are concentrating on a spell). This effect ends early if the creature takes any damage. Until this illusion ends, the creature thinks it is lost in a dark diasporic version of reality, the appearance of which you choose. The creature can see and hear only itself, you, and the illusion - the experience (if frightening) deals d8 psychic damage each round when the effect is ended they are frightened of you. If the effect was charming, they gain the belief they are healed and fully restored as if a long rest - they are not, and they'll think they are casting spells, using abilities they cannot use.
{@i You must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.}

classFeature.name: Enervate (d12)
entries: At 15th level, your Enervation die changes to (1d12).

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Philosophy feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Martial Archetype.

classFeature.name: Channel snort "Divinity"
entries: At 18th level, you can channel 3 times per long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: A cookie
entries: at 20th level, you get...
.... a Cookie.
Congrats.
(yep, that's it. bask in the nihilism)

classFeature.name: Good Plain Folk
entries: You are proficient in the use of artisan's tools as weapons, and add your expertise bonus when attacking with them. The deal 1d4 of whatever damage type is appropriate for the tool.
All of your ability scores are 10, and cannot be naturally increased. You are nothing special.

classFeature.name: Callow Youth
entries: And yet you know you're destined for greatness! You can give yourself advantage on any d20 roll by gritting your teeth and looking danger in the eye. You regain the use of this ability when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: The Darnedest Thing
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can survive the adventuring life through sheer coincidence. When you would be killed or reduced to 0 hp, you may tell the story (10 seconds or less) of how the darnedest thing happened that completely prevented the effect. You regain the use of this ability when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Sidekick
entries: You're surrournded by badasses, why not be like them!? When you finish a long rest, pick an ally you can see. Choose one piece of equipment, one skill, and one saving throw with which that ally is proficient. You gain those proficiencies until you choose a new ally or you spend more than 3 days without spending time with the chosen ally.

classFeature.name: Questgiver
entries: At 3rd level, whenever you finish a short or long rest, a bright yellow exclamation mark appears above your head. Choose up to three allies within 10 feet, and give them each one of the following quests:

entries.name: Main Plot Quest
entries: Whenever your group completes an encounter that gives experience, you and the ally each heal for up to 1d6 per commoner level you have. Faint sparkles and a {@italic ding} sound surrounds you.

entries.name: Kill Quest
entries: Whevenever you take the Attack or Help action against a creature, the alley can add your proficiency bonus to all damage rolls against that creature until the start of your next turn. You can Help the ally as a bonus action.

entries.name: Escort Quest
entries: You and the ally each gain the effect of the {@spell Warding Bond} spell until you rest again, but your speed is reduced by 5 feet as you make barely relevant comments about your surroundings.
You can have no more than three active Quests.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: HA! Just kidding. You still cannot raise your scores above 10.
Take a feat

classFeature.name: Commoner Combo
entries: Starting at 5th level, you're beginning to think you're good at this! And every {@italic real} hero needs a kickass personal move list.
When you hit with your artisan's tools, you can shout the name of a special move to add {dice 5d4} damage to the attack and choose one of the following effects:

items: You Shove the target

The target must make a DC 12 Dexterity save. If it fails, it is blinded, grappled, poisoned, or charmed (your choice) until the start of your next turn. Explain how your tools accomplished this effect.
One ally gains advantage on their next attack against the target.
You gain temporary hit points equal to your commoner level.

entries: You can use this ability 3 times, and regain all uses after a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: The Gosh Darnedeset Thing
entries: Starting at 6th level, your regain the {@bold The Darnedest Thing} whne you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Glass Half Full
entries: Starting at 7th level, if an attack or effect would inflict more than half of your current hp, it deals half your current hp (rounded up) instead.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to 2 +  your charisma modifier (HA!!), and it refreshes when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You still cannot raise your scores above 10. ... you do get that right?
Take a feat

classFeature.name: Waste Not, Want Not
entries: By level 9, you have been collecting scrap and hand-me-downs and somehow cobbled them into something functional. You gain an uncommon magic item of your choice -- subject to DM approval -- ideally based on your artisan's tools.
You gain a new uncommon item at level 11, a rare item at level 13, and a very rare item at level 18.

classFeature.name: Never Did Know my Grandma
entries: At level 10, you convince yourself that you must be something special. Maybe you're part dragon! Or part rust monster! Choose one of the following benefits

items: You gain proficiency in any saving throw.
Your artisan's tools deal an extra {@dice 5d4} damage.
One ability score is no longer capped at 10. It instantly becomes 16.

classFeature.name: Waste Not, Want Not II
entries: By level 11, you have been collecting scrap and hand-me-downs and somehow cobbled them into something functional. You gain an additional uncommon magic item of your choice -- subject to DM approval -- ideally based on your artisan's tools.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: All scores increase to 30.
Kidding. You {@italic still} cannot raise your scores above 10.
Take another feat

classFeature.name: Waste Not, Want Not III
entries: By level 13, you have been collecting scrap and hand-me-downs and somehow cobbled them into something functional. You gain a rare magic item of your choice -- subject to DM approval -- ideally based on your artisan's tools.

classFeature.name: Not Worth Your Time, Milord
entries: At level 14, you have mastered the art of avoiding the gaze of the great and powerful. When an enemy targets you (and only you), roll a d4. On a 1 or a 2, the enemy's action resolves as normal. On a 3, it targets another valid target. On a 4, it stares at you in confusion, wondering how a commoner got this far.

classFeature.name: Didn't Know Grandpa Either
entries: At level 15, you can pick another benefit from Never Did Know my Grandma. You can choose the same one twice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: ok NOW you can....
Psych! You still cannot raise your scores above 10.
Take another feat

classFeature.name: Not So Common After All
entries: At level 17, you've managed to master your artisan's tools, despite all this adventuring! They add a +3 bonus to all attack, damage, and crafting rolls made with them, and you have world class skill in their use. Your DM will tell you what you can do with that, because crafting rules (RAW) are often just thrown out.

classFeature.name: Waste Not, Want Not IV
entries: By level 18, you have been collecting scrap and hand-me-downs and somehow cobbled them into something functional. You gained an very rare magic item of your choice -- subject to DM approval -- ideally based on your artisan's tools.

classFeature.name: Whew, Take a Breather Champ
entries: At level 19, you have crippling existential crisis as you ponder what it means to be a 19th level commoner.

classFeature.name: Big Damn Hero, Sir
entries: At 20th level, you can have up to 8 Questgiver quests active at once.

classFeature.name: Infusions
entries: You gain the ability to create Infusions. Infusions are neither arcane nor divine; they are drawn from the complex Magical Schemas and then infused into the forms listed below. They function just like spells and follow all the rules for spells. For example, an infusion can be dispelled, it will not function in an antimagic area, and an artificer must make a Concentration check if injured while attempting to imbue/place an infusion (failure means the infusion is stopped and must be restarted).

As an Artificer, you use Schemas (see below) in combination with your known Infusion Formulae (See Below) from the list formulae you have learned/created/or discovered. Like spell casters, you automatically gain Infusions as you progress. Like Wizards, it is possible for you to learn new infusions and Schemas. These might include ancient infusions you find in the ruins of Xen'drik or secret infusions known only to the members of certain guilds or organizations.

Infusions have longer casting times and you will need to plan ahead as several infusions will take hours (at times even weeks) to cast, and as such you cast them from your books - without them... you are nearly powerless.

entries.name: Arcane Schema
entries: You are able to learn a spell's schemas that you keep in your schema book. A schema differs from a spell in that a schema doesn't pull the magic to create the effect - it the understanding needed to infuse the power of that Schema into an item but not to cast the spell itself. Therefore, you cannot cast the spell directly (but are able to create scrolls or wands with the spell's ability imbued within it). Some Schema's knowledge also allows you to research and create Formulae that have the prerequisite spell as a requirement for creation.

As with Infusions, schemas are not the same as a warlock's, a cleric, sorcerer or even a wizard's magic - being neither arcane or divine in nature, but are those spell's underlying pattern, the most basic form of the magic's effect. Any other class would not be able to pick up the book and reverse engineer the spell schema into a workable spell. (DM's Fiat obviously overrides that).

You can also copy the addition spells into your schema book by examining a scroll, a spell book, schema book (This does not use up the book). Artificer's automatically know how to use any of their known spells as schemas and does not need to keep schema of the spell in their schema book -- for spells gained from multi-classing, however, this does not go both ways. They may not use Spell Schema's they've learned as spells and cast them through the use of spell slots.

Additionally, Whenever another creature casts a spell (and is within your schema level range), as a reaction you can make an Arcane (Intelligence) check against the caster's spell DC. If successful you remember the details of the spell and can add it to your schema book. You can only hold onto one spell until you've copied it, and you are must maintain concentration to hold the spell schema in memory until the copying is completed. Copying Schemas costs 20gp and 1 hour per spell slot (though some infusions may reduce that time).

When starting off as an Artificer you start with 2 + Intelligence ability modifier spell slot levels of schemas in your schema book. Those schemas must be of a level no greater than your Proficiency bonus (Cantrips count as 1 spell slot.)

entries.name: Infusion Formulae
entries: Formulae are essentially the pattern and plan of the infusion for the Artificer. A formulae often requires specific schemas and materials which are either used up, may be recovered, or are now forever part of the object being infused.

As a general rule, if the DM allows for Artificers to develop/research additional Formulae it is suggested to use the DMG guidance for magic item creation with the value of 1,000gp cost per infusion point.

entries.name: Infusion Points
entries: You are limited to certain amount of mystical energy you draw upon each day. This is referred to as your Infusion points. You maximum Infusion points are equal to the Points listed in the table above for your level. At the dawn of each day your used infusion points are restored.¬π In general, Infusions maintain themselves for 24 hours, or until the Dawn of the next day. You may never have unexpended Infusion Points that exceeds the Maximum Infusions points for your level plus your Intelligence modifier.

Creating an Infusion costs a number of Infusion Points, as noted in the Infusion's description, and also costs materials (also noted in the Infusion's Descriptions). When an item is under the effect of an Infusion, that item is considered magical for the purposes of Detect Magic, Identify and Dispel Magic, but unless the infusion states otherwise, NOT for purposes of overcoming damage resistances or immunities. The total number of Infusion Points invested in a single item or Automaton cannot exceed the caster's Infusion Maximum. [This is a clarification for when multiple Artificers are working together on a single item]

entries.name: Spellcasting/Infusion Ability
entries: Artificers do not obtain spell slots, for purposes of spell descriptions and multiclassing, your Artificer levels are full caster levels, but again you gain no spell slots while advancing in Artificer.
Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for you artificer spells. You use your Intelligence modifier whenever an Infusion or spell refers to your spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Infusion List
entries: At 1st level all Artificers know the Infusions for {@spell Light|} and {@spell Repair|}.
Each {@b Field of Study}(FOS) grants you additional infusions as you level, if you are granted an infusion you already know you may choose any other infusion.

entries.name: The Magic of Artifice
entries: You spend the time gaining experience between each level developing your next infusion(s); in your downtime, during rests, doodling at taverns, etc etc.

{@b DM's Option}: Artificers may be taught or develop additional infusions, thought this should be viewed as VERY unlikely as the artificers view their formulae as trade secrets/nearly sacred, though still... some guilds and houses may provide specific guidance. Your DM may opt to replace the list of infusions learned at different levels, with specific infusions that are House/Clan/Guild mandated.

classFeature.name: Consumable Proficiency
entries: You are considered proficient in improvised weapons for attack rolls required by your Consumables. In addition, you may throw your Consumables twice as far (commonly 10/40).

classFeature.name: Field of Study
entries: At 1st level, you choose a Field of Study (Fos) for your Artificer and  gain a feature from that Field of Study.

classFeature.name: Artificer's Expertise
entries: At 2nd level, choose either two of your skill proficiencies based on Intelligence, one skill based on Intelligence and one tool proficiency, or two tool proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen.

classFeature.name: Minions
entries: Likewise you may speed 1 week and 250 gp building one of the following: {@creature Clockwork Helper|MMMxArtificer}, {@creature Mechanical Agent|MMMxArtificer}, or {@creature Iron Grappler|MMMxArtificer}. This does not count against the number of constructs you can control, but does count against your ability to summon a familiar.

You may only have the one minion active at a time and you may not dismiss it as with {@spell Familiars|find familiar|phb}. Minions upon reaching 0 Hp are not destroyed (provided it was not disintegrated) it is instead rendered inert and you need only repair the construct to full health to bring it back to functional.
Nothing prevents you from making additional minions, but they remain intert until they are swapped out to be the active Minion, this takes 10 minutes.

items: {@b At 11th Level} you may have 2 minions active at a time.

classFeature.name: Artificer's Senses
entries: At 3rd level, you develop your ability to trace the dweomer of magic items. You can expend concentration and take 1 minute to gain the effect of a {@spell Detect Magic|phb} on a specific item or read, and if you continue to maintain concentration over the period of a short rest you gain the effects of an {@spell Identify|phb} spell (This does not require any components Verbal, Somnatic, Material nor does it use any spell slots)

items: {@b At 7th Level} when you concentrate you are considered to always be under the effect of {@spell Detect Magic|phb}, and it takes you only 10 minutes to gain the effect of an {@spell Identify|phb} spell.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Enduring Enchantment
entries: At 5th level when you create an infusion you may choose to enhance the dweomer making it last for 1 step longer. Doing this costs the Artificer dearly, reducing their Maximum Health by twice the Infusion point cost, takes a point of Constitution damage, and gains/adds a level of Exhaustion. The character does not regain the Infusion Point(s), CONstitution damage until either the Infusion(s) is(are) broken, used or a week has passed. Exhaustion can be removed as normal.

items: {@b At 11th Level}, your Infusions can last up to two weeks. (Charged Items regain charges (not to exceed their MAX) at the start of each day)
{@b At 17th Level}, you no longer gain levels of Exhaustion when you use this feature.

classFeature.name: Universal Attunement
entries: At 6th level, the Artificer's intimate familiarity with magic, and magical equipment allows them to gain the benefits of most any item intuitively. The artificer is may attune any magic item even if the item has class or level restrictions.

items: {@b At 10th Level}, you may now attune an additional item (Typically this means 4), and it only takes 10 minutes for you to attune an object.

{@b At 15th Level}, you may now attune an additional item (Typically this means 5)It takes you 1 minute to attune. If another creature is already attuned to the item, it the attunement isn't agreed upon the Artificer should make a resisted arcana check with its current owner.

classFeature.name: FoS Feature
entries: Yyou gain a feature granted by your Artificer Field of Study.

classFeature.name: Vocational Advancement
entries: At 7th level you add half of your proficiency bonus to your attempts with any tools in which you do not have expertise.

classFeature.name: Sage Sight
entries: At 7th level, Once per long rest, you may take 10 minutes to generate the effects of Legend Lore (no components are needed) on a magical item, but the lore is focused on its arcane lore, history and persons around such can be provided, but not in great depth.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 8th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Enchant
entries: At 9th level, once per short rest, as an Action you may (at no cost) surround a melee weapon or up 20 bolts/arrows/stones with a magical field that counts as a magical weapon but gives no bonus to attack or damage. The effect last until a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: OverCharge
entries: At 11th level, when using a magical item with charges, you may use your own infusion points to power the device. By expending 1 Infusion point plus 1 point per spell slot level of the effect, you grant the device an additional charge, and/or (where possible) increase the effective spell slot of the effect being generated.

classFeature.name: FoS Feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature granted by your Artificer Field of Study.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: FoS Feature
entries: At 14th level, Yyou gain a feature granted by your Artificer Field of Study.

classFeature.name: Artificer Specialist Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Artificer Specialist choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: FOS Feature
entries: Yyou gain a feature granted by your Artificer Field of Study.

classFeature.name: Enduring Enchantment (2)
entries: At 17th level, you no longer gain levels of Exhaustion when you use this feature.

classFeature.name: FoS Feature
entries: Yyou gain a feature granted by your Artificer Field of Study.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: FoS Feature
entries: Yyou gain a feature granted by your Artificer Field of Study.

subclassFeature.name: Delayed Gratification
entries: You get nothing. That's the way that goes - you have to make the choice and see what comes from your choices

subclassFeature.name: Divine Filler
entries: Choose one of the following:

entries.name: Channel Futility: Janusian Blessing
entries: Target creature you see in 60 ft. they as an action simultaneously rolls a 20 and a 1 for their next roll attempt, taking the results of these rolls together.
For example, they managed to pick the lock, but also break their thieve's tools, or makes the attack against a creature, but drops their weapon as they fall prone before it.

entries.name: Channel Futility: Mediocrity
entries: {@i Requires Concentration}

The effort you make ultimately only offsets the failures you'll suffer. When you channel Futility, whenever any creature (including yourself) within 50 ft. makes an attack, saving throw or ability check, unless the result is a natural "1" or "20" their roll is considered to be an "8" + any bonuses (Any creature with Expertise has their expertise suppressed while Mediocrity is enforced.) Mediocrity lasts up to 10 minutes or until concentration is lost (special note: Concentration Checks for the Dirge are unaffected by mediocrity)

entries.name: Channel Futility: Bitter Frustration
entries: {@i Requires Concentration}
Things just don't go as they should, which is predictable, which means they go as they should... which means...
... sigh...

When you channel Futility, you create a bubble with a 30 ft. radius centered on you. All rolls (to hit, saves, skill and ability checks) inside the affected area are at disadvantage and are further subject to the negative bonus equal to your Intelligence Modifier. Creatures take 1 point psychic damage if they fail their effort. The effect's duration is concentration, (also at disadvantage) or until 10 minutes have passed.
at each subsquent dirge level you may exchange your current channel ability for a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Didn't Even Try
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you gain the hinder action. You may choose a target within 15 ft. and that target has disadvantage on their next ability check or attack action.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Filler
entries: Choose one of the following:

entries.name: Channel Futility: Janusian Blessing
entries: Target creature you see in 60 ft. they as an action simultaneously rolls a 20 and a 1 for their next roll attempt, taking the results of these rolls together.
For example, they managed to pick the lock, but also break their thieve's tools, or makes the attack against a creature, but drops their weapon as they fall prone before it.

entries.name: Channel Futility: Mediocrity
entries: {@i Requires Concentration}

The effort you make ultimately only offsets the failures you'll suffer. When you channel Futility, whenever any creature (including yourself) within 50 ft. makes an attack, saving throw or ability check, unless the result is a natural "1" or "20" their roll is considered to be an "8" + any bonuses (Any creature with Expertise has their expertise suppressed while Mediocrity is enforced.) Mediocrity lasts up to 10 minutes or until concentration is lost (special note: Concentration Checks for the Dirge are unaffected by mediocrity)

entries.name: Channel Futility: Bitter Frustration
entries: {@i Requires Concentration}
Things just don't go as they should, which is predictable, which means they go as they should... which means...
... sigh...

When you channel Futility, you create a bubble with a 30 ft. radius centered on you. All rolls (to hit, saves, skill and ability checks) inside the affected area are at disadvantage and are further subject to the negative bonus equal to your Intelligence Modifier. Creatures take 1 point psychic damage if they fail their effort. The effect's duration is concentration, (also at disadvantage) or until 10 minutes have passed.
at each subsquent dirge level you may exchange your current channel ability for a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Pointless Persuit
entries: Starting at 14th level, you instill within a creature the certainty that its current path is fruitless and to abandon the effort. As an action, choose a creature that you can see within 20 feet of you. It must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, it is effectively charmed by you. Whatever the DM holds as its current goal/action it abandons. (ie A Creature in a battle might stop and leave combat; a person eating will stop). This effect lasts up to 1 hour. If a new reason to engage in that same action comes up again, that creature can re-engage. In the example of the combat, if another creature attacks it while it is attempting to leave combat, it gets to save again. A creature that saves cannot be the subject of this ability again for a day.
{@i You must finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.}

subclassFeature.name: Delayed Gratification
entries: You get nothing. That's the way that goes - you have to make the choice and see what comes from your choices

subclassFeature.name: Divine Filler
entries: Choose one of the following:

entries.name: Channel Apathy: Undead
entries: You get it. Being Alive sucks and being undead isn't an improvement. When you channel your Apathy, all undead creatures that can hear or see you within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is apathetic for 1 minute or until it takes damage from you. An apathetic creature will disengage and move at half rate back to its resting place. It will ignore any creature not trying to attack it (treat as if invisible).
{@i For example, they managed to pick the lock, but also break their thieve's tools ruining the lock, or makes the attack against a creature, but drops their weapon as they fall prone before it.

entries.name: Channel Apathy: Death
entries: The Afterlife, if it exists, is likely eternal suffering. This joker in front of you would only add to the misery of those miserable souls. Meh, call yourself sentimental for that pet you watched die that time. your pet doesn't deserve this A-Hole's whining filling the afterworld(s).

You channel your power to bring a creature that had died up to a minute ago, back to life with 1 hp. They and you have resistance to healing for 1 day, and you have disadvantage on all Social checks against that creature in the future.

entries.name: Channel Apathy: Ignore
entries: {@i Requires Concentration}

When you channel Apathy, you become, effectively, invisible for up to 1 hour.  Unlike the spell, this is a enchantment, creatures of intelligence 5 or greater are magically presuaded to not want to see, hear or interact with you.  They wish to ignore you if possible. Furthermore you create a bubble with a 30 ft. radius centered on you. All perception or insight rolls inside the affected area are at disadvantage.

You may speak and limitedly take action - thou any attack on a creature will remove that creature's from enchantment's effect.  All others must make an intelligence save if your interactions would violate their moral or professional code.  A guardsman being potentially aware of you stealing something would get a save. A person wanting or needing to get through a door you are standing infront of would trigger a saving throw check. Perhaps eating food off a nobleman's or starving peasant's plate would prompt either to choose to not ignore you and thus trigger a save.

A person free of the enchantment must make a persuasion check against either the spell's DC to get everyone in the area to take notice, or may attempt to focus on a single person as an action to force that person to attempt to no longer ignore the Dirge. (prompting a saving throw).
Once a creature has successfully saved they see you (the Dirge) and cannot be effected by another Ignore channel for a day, and gain advantage on all future attempts to force them to ignore.
at each subsquent dirge level you may exchange your current channel ability for a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Yeah... Whatever
entries: Beginning at 10th level, when making a saving throw against an ability that deals Psychic damage or imposes the Charm, Frightened, or condition. You may choose to take a level of exhaustion to automatically succeed provided the Charmed, or Frighted condition effect have not yet been applied.

subclassFeature.name: Life?... meh.
entries: The archetypal Champion focuses on the development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection. Those who model themselves on this archetype combine rigorous training with physical excellence to deal devastating blows.

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

subclassFeature.name: Delayed Gratification
entries: You get nothing. That's the way that goes - you have to make the choice and see what comes from your choices. Later on.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Filler
entries: Choose one of the following:

entries.name: Channel Dysfunction: Pauli Effect
entries: Things break down, don't work, more so around you. When you channel all other creatures within 30 ft. of you immediately lose attunement to their magical item(s).

entries.name: Channel Dysfunction: Juxtaposition
entries: Things never make sense, but then again they shouldn't obviously we're not here for {@i a reason} we're just here, wherever that is. As either a bonus action or a reaction you may channel this power, make a ranged to hit roll for a creature or object that you can see or know its absolute position (are very familiar with) within 100 ft. You and that target change places. If the creature is hostile, it gets a Dexterity Save to avoid being shifted, and instead, you appear in its square crowding it.

entries.name: Channel Dysfunction: Leech
entries: {@i Requires Concentration}

You not only suck the fun out events, you suck the very luck from the room as well. When you channel this you create a 20'ft radius aura. All creatures except you in the radius have a -d4 for all their Ability, Skill, and initative checks. Damage amounts are also reduced by 1. The effect last for 1 minute or until concentration is broken.
at each subsquent dirge level you may exchange your current channel ability for a different one.

The Pauli effect is a term referring to the apparently mysterious, anecdotal failure of technical equipment in the presence of Austrian theoretical physicist Wolfgang Pauli. The term was coined using his name after numerous instances in which demonstrations involving equipment suffered technical problems only when he was present

subclassFeature.name: Entrophic Ward
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you learn to magically ward yourself against attack and to turn an enemy's failed strike into good luck for yourself, When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that roll. If the attack misses you, before the end of your text turn your next attack roll against that creature has advantage. On a critical fail against you, you regain a use of enervation.
{@i You may use this feature (Int Modifier) times every short or long rest.}

subclassFeature.name: Solipsism
entries: Starting at 14th level, as an action you create an extra-natural force. The Dirge and whomever he informs of his intent must make a Wisdom save against the Dirge's Charisma ability score as the DC. On a successful save all those that succeeded experience the Solipsism as real. Unlike true illusions, the image created by this spell does more than just duplicate reality. The image formed is real for those who believe in it. The illusion has all the normal properties that its form and function allow. Thus, a solipsistic bridge spanning a chasm could be crossed by the dirge and those who believed. All others would see the priest apparently walking out onto nothingness. A Solipsism of a barrier would block a dragon's breath weapon. Creatures are not affected (the dragon) by the Solipsism would be able to move through the object as if doesn't exist (because, to them - it does not).
Solipsism can create only illusions that are external to the Dirge. Thus, the Dirge cannot create an illusion that he is the size of a giant, is unwounded, or has sprouted wings

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist
entries: Alchemisten sind Meister der Mixturen, Tr√§nke und Reagenzien. Sie k√∂nnen Tr√§nke schneller herstellen als andere Artificer und sind geschickt darin, das Potenzial von Kreaturen zu verbessern. Sie verf√ºgen √ºber einige Heilf√§higkeiten und sind in Verbindung mit dem Agent Minion ein effektives Transportmittel auf dem Schlachtfeld.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@item Alchemist Kit|phb} & {@item Glassblower's Tools|phb}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain expertise.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Infusion
entries: You gain 1 additional Infusion with each level.
{@i The infusion must be of the type "Consumable".}

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist's Knowledge
entries: At 1st level, you learn the either Acid or Potion of Health and the Potion of¬π.. Infusions.

items: {@b At 5th level}, you learn *Potion of¬≤..* Infusion.
{@b At 9th level}, you learn *Potion of¬≥..* or the *Flashbang Infusion* Infusions.
{@b At 13th level}, you learn *Potion of‚Å¥..* or the *Potion of Vitality* Infusions.
{@b At 17th level}, you learn *Potion of‚Åµ..* or the *Bottled Storm* Infusion.

subclassFeature.name: Quick and Unstable Consumables
entries: At 1st level you are able to spend a bonus action to create a consumable potion that cost one less infusion point (down to zero), and degrades into uselessness at the end of your turn. The Unstable Consumable may be generated as powerful as if you had spent two points at 6th level, and as powerful as if four points at 14th level.
Acid, Alchemist's Fire, Alchemist's Frost, Holy Water, Holywrath Stone, ICB, Poison, Sympathetic Balm, Phosphorus Stick, Tanglefoot Bag, Thunderstone, or Universal Antidote for no infusion cost.
The Unstable Consumable created degrade into uselessness at end of your turn.

items: {@b At 5th level}, you may pick another from the additional Unstable Consumable list.
{@b At 10th level}, you add another Unstable Consumable List; which now expands to include: *Alchemist's Acid*, *Greasebomb*, and *Smokebomb*.
{@b At 15th level}, you add another Unstable Consumable that you've figured out how to quickly craft.

subclassFeature.name: Combine Consumables
entries: At 3rd level,

subclassFeature.name: Combine Consumables
entries: At 6th level, when you create a Consumable, you can create a single Consumable out of the effects of two Consumables. If both Consumables require a ranged attack, you resolve the Consumable with a single attack roll.

For example, you can spend 2 points on an Acid effect, and 2 point on an Alchemist's Fire effect. On a hit, this Consumable would deal 4d6 + 2 acid damage, and cause the target to begin taking 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. (Note normally mixing magical potions results in very possible Miscibility Misfires See DMG)

items: {@b At 14th level}, you can combine 3 Consumable effects.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Consumables
entries: At 11th level, the dice used by your manufactured Consumables increases by 1 size. (d4 increases to d6, d6 increases to d8, d8 increases to d10, d10 increases to d12, and d12 increases to 2d8).

subclassFeature.name: Healing Infusion
entries: At 14th level, whenever you create a potion, you can also infuse it with one of the following effects:

items: {@b Curative Admixture}, The character that drinks the potion heals 1 hit points per Infusion Point spent on the potion.

{@b Resistive Formula}, The character that drinks the potion gains resistance to acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant,
or thunder damage until the start
of your next turn.

{@b Shielding Elixir}, The character
that drinks the potion gains 1
temporary hit point per Infusion
Point it cost.

subclassFeature.name: Chemical Mastery
entries: By 20th level, you create two of that consumable for the expense.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Engineer
entries: Arkane Ingenieure konzentrieren sich mehr auf die Entwicklung von Zauberschemata als auf Infusionsformeln. Sie tauschen einen Teil ihrer F√§higkeit, magische Ger√§te herzustellen, gegen die F√§higkeit, Zauber zu wirken. Sie sind ein schlechter Zauberer, aber sie sind der einzige Artificer, der direkt und unmittelbar zaubern kann.

entries.subclassFeature: Arcane Engineer's Additional Spell List|Artificer|MMMxArtificer|Arcane Engineer|MMMxArtificer|1

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in Arcana (or expertise if already proficient).

subclassFeature.name: Cantrip
entries: You learn two Cantrips from the following list: {@spell Gust}, {@spell Control Flames}, {@spell Mage Hand}, {@spell Magic Stone}, or {@spell Light}

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Knowledge
entries: You learn three 1st-level spells of your choice from either the Wizard or the Expanded spell list below.
You learn an additional spell at every odd level taken in the Artificer class. Your spellcasting ability is Intelligence. The spells you learn may not exceed the following chart.

items: {@b At 4th level}, you can learn 2nd level spells.
{@b At 7th level}, you can learn 3rd level spells.
{@b At 10th level}, you can learn 4th level spells.
{@b At 14th level}, you can learn 5th level spells.
{@b At 17th level}, you can learn 6th level spells.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Spellcasting
entries: At 1st level you can cast any spell you know. (Spells and Schemas are different things) Doing so uses infusion points equal to twice the spell slot used, you may not use a higher spell slot then the highest spell level you can learn.
You also gain {@b Overcharge} (as per the 9th level ability)

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Artificer  table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of spells that are available for you to cast. To do so, choose a number of wizard spells from your spellbook equal to your Intelligence modifier + your wizard level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you're a 3rd-level wizard, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With an Intelligence of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination, chosen from your spellbook. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell magic missile}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of wizard spells requires time spent studying your spellbook and memorizing the incantations and gestures you must make to cast the spell: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Ritual Spellcasting:
entries: You can cast any spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag. Doing so uses 1 infusion point regardless of its level.

entries.name: Arcane Adaptability:
entries: When you learn a spell you may instead learn a variant of that spell (chosen upon leveling up), if the spell does a damage type, you may cast a variant of the spell which does another form of damage or gives another equal condition (ie - deaf and silenced; converted to restrained and grappled) or requires a different Save (Dex vs Wis). You may develop a variant version of 1 spell at every even level taken in the Artificer class.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Engineer's Additional Spell List
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Arcane Engineer Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Arcane Engineer
rows: 1st
{@spell Shield}, {@spell Tenser's Floating Disc}, {@spell Detect Magic}, {@spell Identify},
4th
{@spell See Invisibilty}, {@spell Nystul's Magic Aura}, {@spell Knock}, {@spell Continual Flame}
7th
{@spell Tiny Servant}, {@spell Leomund's Tiny Hut}
10th
{@spell Freedom of Movement}, {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum}, {@spell Arcane Eye}
14th
